question: For whom of the persons mentioned above does § 241a HGB apply, assuming the numbers apply for two consecutive financial years?

Businessman Mr. Schneider has operated his commercial business for a long time. In the past years he realized annual revenues and annual profits as follows :
Year 10: --------- Year 11: --------- Year 12: --------- Year 13:
Profit ----------- Profit ----------- Profit ----------- Profit
58.000 € --------- 61.000 € --------- 60.000 € --------- 58.000 €
Revenue ---------- Revenue ---------- Revenue ---------- Revenue
592.000 € -------- 598.000 € -------- 600.000 € -------- 596.000 €
Mr. Schneider wishes to quit bookkeeping in terms of commercial law as soon as possible. Which is the earliest date possible?

Small business owner Mr. Schulze has been exempted from the obligation to keep books, since he has come below the criteria of §241a HGB until now. In year 10 he has realized a fiscal profit of 58.000 € and fiscal revenues of 585.000 €. If he was subject to the duty of keeping books, he still would have to take receivables totaling 32.000 € into account. This however would lead to higher revenues. According to net fiscal income method receivables are not taken into account. The receivables contain a share in profits of 10.000 €. How to proceed further in year 11?
options: A Mr. Schulze does not exceed the limitations of § 241a HGB and therefore does not have to keep books.
B Mr. Schulze already should have kept books in year 10.
C Mr. Schulze has to keep books starting in year 11.
D Mr. Schulze has to keep books starting in year 12, since criteria of §241a HGB have to be exceeded in two consecutive years.
